multiple_choice.choice: underutilized muscle fibers lie dormant and are not used

response.feedback: Incorrect. We need to be able reversibly add and remove muscle mass. If muscle cells die, there would not be a possibility for increasing muscle mass since muscle cells do not divide.
Incorrect. These muscles are not used by they also reduce in size.
Correct. Cells undergo atrophy (loss of mass) and hypertrophy (increase in mass).

part.hint: When muscles grow with exercise, they hypertrophy.
Hypertrophy means that cells get bigger; cells do not divide to make more.
